data.title: Scroller in editor
data.body:
Open editor. Start debug  (Now debugger window is opened). Stop debug (Now debugger window is closed).
Try to scroll. Opps. You've spend 10 seconds of your life again. BECAUSE U CANT DO IT.

data.title: Silence during wrong-connected signal handler call
data.body:
The most dangerous bugs are bugs which you know nothing about.

Check this out:

```
extends Control

func someHandler():
    print("I've got it")

func _ready():
    add_user_signal("someSignal")
    connect("someSignal", self, "someHandler")
    emit_signal("someSignal")      # I've got it 
    emit_signal("someSignal", 10)  # Nothing happens
```

You may think that it is not a big deal but I can say that it is REALLY annoying. I've spent few hours to find the bug.

data.title: Viewport breaks TextureButton
data.body:
When I enable "stretch_aspect : viewport" in Project Settings, TextureButtons stop registering clicks, although they display correctly.
 I think it's similar to this issue https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/10

data.title: Add LICENSE.txt
data.body:
- Add LICENSE.txt as central place to cover license terms used by all libraries including Godot itself.
- Easier for new developer to get whole picture of Godot licenses
- User can choose to package this file in released game if he/she wants full clarification on third-party code license

data.title: Add multi-select to project manager
data.body:
- Support multi-select in project manager, useful for erasing multiple projects
- Hold Shift to select items in range
- Hold Control to multi-select items one at a time

data.title: Make builtin openssl optional on windows, save 1M runtime size
data.body:
- And user can enable built-in openssl anytime by passing "openssl=builtin" to scons
- Save 1.2M runtime size on windows for games don't require ssl capability

data.title: Fixed MingW windows build command line too long issue
data.body:
- Bypass MingW windows long command line argument limitation
- Tested with scons-2.3.1
- Served as temporary workaround for mingw windows build until better solution surface

data.title: r300: ERROR: FS input FACE unassigned
data.body:
Whenever I do something (view, edit or just run) 3D in Godot, the terminal does spam a lot this:
"r300: ERROR: FS input FACE unassigned."

and all the textures have a weird look (when not just plain black)

this is how I do see the TestCube

http://img143.imagevenue.com/img.php?image=57188_screen_122_384lo.jpg

Specs:
ATI Radeon X700 (laptop integrated GPU)
32bit Lubuntu 13.10

glxinfo:
direct rendering: Yes
OpenGL renderer string: Gallium 0.4 on ATI RV410
    GL_MESA_ycbcr_texture, GL_NV_blend_square, GL_NV_conditional_render,

Everything else (2s) seems working fine

data.title: Sort projects by last modified/accessed date in project manager
data.body:
- new created project will appear on top of the list now
- sort recent projects by last modified/accessed date, make it easier to track recently accessed projects

data.title: Static call from static
data.body:
```
static func foo(num):
    return num + num

static func boo(num):
    return foo(num)
```

`Parser error: 'self' not present in static function!`

Great, really ?

data.title: Editor folding
data.body:
I think it is an awesome feature.
Fold methods and class definitions

data.title: Crash when deleting node while in CollisionPolygon2D edit mode
data.body:
Godot crashes when you delete a node in the hierachy while editing a CollisionPolygon2D.

Hitting "del" key while drawing a polygon tries to delete the selected node in the treeview on the right instead of the last element of the currently drawn polygon. Without reading the messagebox carefully it is possible to delete the CollisionPolygon2D node and simultaneously crash godot.

It would be nice if hitting "del" while editing the polygon would delete the last element instead of the node.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Add a CollisionPolygon2D
2)  edit the CollisionPolygon2D shape and place come elements
3) hit "del" on keyboard + confirm
4) crash

data.body:
- Create an app with a button
- Set resizing support
- Export it as a Linux bin
- Click button (should be ok)
- Resize 
- Click.... Oppps. It is not working....

data.title: Incorrect orientation of the splashscreen, in portrait view in android
data.body:
Hi, 
The error occurs in an application in portrait view. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5366368/2825364/a11e84b2-cf4a-11e3-85a3-679f68ebdb52.png)

The settings are: "config / display / orientation / portrait" in the project settings, and "screen / orientation / portrait" in the export settings for android. 

The display screen shows the logo incorrectly (horizontally), in portrait view. 

This apparently happens because when the 2d context is created, the game is first resized to the dimensions of the landscape view, and then resized to the dimensions of the vertical view. 

Apparently, the context is created and resized before reading the settings. 

This is what the logcat shows:

```

I/godot   ( 7146): [1;31;40mERROR: create: [1;37;40mCondition ' !create_func ' is true. returned: 0

I/godot   ( 7146): [1;31;40mERROR: set_custom_property_info: [1;37;40mCondition ' !props.has(p_prop) ' is true.
I/godot   ( 7146): [0;31;40m   At: core/globals.cpp:1318.[0;0;37m
```

Please forgive my English, it's the best I got with google translator xD

G.M.

data.title: StreamPlayer in OSX/Windows export version bug
data.body:
When playing very small ogg-sounds with StreamPlayer, it will cause in a lag and not playing the sound at all. However when the game is started from within the Godot-Editor it works... 

Reproduce: Take the game here: https://bitbucket.org/meniku/ld29 (branch: streamplayer_issues), export it in Godot and try to drag and drop some pipes, you'll notice the lags.

EDIT: got the problems solved: turned out that I should have used the SamplePlayer instead of StreamPlayer for such small files. I left the buggy-version in the streamplayer_issues branch.

data.title: Node groups are not set when duplicating nodes with META+D
data.body: Node groups are not set when duplicating nodes with META+D

data.title: get_children_with_group()
data.body: It would be nice, if the Node-class would have a method get_children_with_group()

data.title: Editor Tabbing hotkeys for OSX
data.body: For OSX selecting next/previous tab should be possible with META+SHIFT+[ and META+SHIFT+] as it's default behaviour by all other applications

data.title: Name of included scene nodes within node hierachie
data.body: It would be handy when the name of scene instances would default to the name of the scene, instead of the name of the root-node of the scene

data.title: AnimatedSprite - SpriteFrames
data.body: It would be handy if it was possible to create frames from SpriteSheets / TileSets

data.title: Tilemap / Tileset suggestions
data.body:
- Tilemap Usage: SHIFT Selection and META+D should be available as Icons, else nobody knows that this optin exists
- Tileset creation: Would be nice if it would be possible to import an Tilemap without having to creat every tile by hand
- Tilemap: Would be nice if it would arrange the tiles in that left bar like I arranged them during the creation of the tilemap - also with multiple columns

data.title: InputFields in the Godot editor's dialogues
data.body: When typing while a range of the text is selected, the selected text should be removed and typing should replace that content. Currently the selected text is not deleted, leaving weird results.

data.title: KinematicBody2D.can_move_to always returns true
data.body:
KinematicBody2D.can_move_to always returns true, even when it's not possible because it's blocked by another kinematic body

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/class_kinematicbody2d#can_move_to

data.title: Snapping settings should be persisted
data.body: Snapping-Settings should be saved (Snap (Pixels) and wether it's active or not)

data.title: Minor Editor UX issues & Bugs
data.body:
Editor:
- Tab-Shift to change indentation should also work when the cursor is not at the beginning of a line
- Shift-Click in should set selection from cursor to Mouse position
- Should be able to comment/uncomment multiple Lines at once ( shift + / )
- Would be nice if it would be able to vertical-select multiple Lines (holding alt-Button)

Bugs (OSX):
- File -> Save as does nothing
- MouseWheel scrolling doesn't work

data.title: Code Formatter
data.body: A way to automatically format code would be very handy. Especially when code is copied and pasted from other editors it can happen that you end up having different identation styles in one file.

data.title: reparent the root-node of a scene
data.body: It would be nice if the root-node could be swapped with one of it's children. Currently I have to delete the whole scene structure when I made a mistake in the node hierarchie
